intro: Senecio copiapinus, commonly known as the Copiapó senecio, is a flowering plant native to Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. It has narrow, silvery-gray leaves that help reduce water loss, and its flowers are usually yellow or orange in color. Senecio copiapinus is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in areas with limited rainfall.
